ResponseText: Do you know the definition of evolution? In one simple sentence (and if you don't give the proper definition, I will give one that I am sure all the people who are on the non-religious side of the argument will agree with), give me your definition of evolution. I have seen many people bluster and make claims.. but often the ones that bluster the most know the least.

I will assume that if you are referring to biology then evolution is change in the inherited traits of a population of organisms from one generation to the next. If we are to assume that your perception of bluster, as noted in your post, is of any relevance, then you know less than anyone on this thread.

The debate title says: "There is absolutely no convincing evidence of the theory of evolution". The science is solid, evolution is a fact, and a cornerstone of modern biology. If there is evidence to the contrary, present a paper to one of the evolution journals. If the evidence is solid, you will change scientific minds. It is impossible to teach evolution in this forum. If you need to understand more about the Theory of Evolution, then I suggest Evolution101 podcast by Zachary Moore found at learnoutloud dot com. (Sorry, this is my first post, I cannot give the url). The core of this debate is in the first part of the title: "There is absolutely no convincing evidence". There is no amount of evidence that may be presented to change the mind of a hard core creationist or <pick your religious creation belief>. Guess what? That is perfectly fine. Teach it in Sunday school or the equivalent. However, do not call on science to defend your religious beliefs. Do not attempt to make a religious belief equal to science. Science is not magic. Science is not faith. It is simply a proven method of acquiring knowledge of our world. That method has improved our world since the Age of Reason. If the science contradicts your religious beliefs and you feel offended, then I am sorry you are offended. Submit the opposing evidence to the scientific journals and you may change my mind.
